name: feloniously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an illegal manner that is a felony (= a serious crime that can be punished by one or more years in prison): Those officers were feloniously killed, meaning murdered by offenders, while the others died of other causes such as auto accidents. The police officer was feloniously killed in the line of duty. It was ruled that the property had been removed feloniously.
More examplesFewer examplesThey were found guilty of feloniously receiving a sum of money in return for voting against the proposal.The military court was satisfied that the officer had feloniously ordered his men to commit murder.
